intro: Wigandia peruviana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Peruvian morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to South America and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a climbing habit and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Wigandia peruviana is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
